headline: Chocolate Crinkle Cookies
description: Brownie-like chocolate crinkle cookies coated in confectioners' sugar are perfect for holidays, parties, or afternoon treats!

video.description: See how to make chocolate cookies coated in confectioners' sugar.
video.name: Chocolate Crinkles II

name: Chocolate Crinkle Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Mix sugar, cocoa, and oil together in a medium bowl. Beat in eggs, one at a time, until combined. Stir in vanilla.
Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in another bowl. Gradually stir dry ingredients into the wet ingredients until thoroughly mixed. Cover dough and refrigerator for at least 4 hours.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.
Roll or scoop chilled dough into 1-inch balls. Coat each ball in confectioners' sugar and place 1 inch apart on the prepared cookie sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes. Let stand on the cookie sheet for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool.
Repeat Steps 4 and 5 to make remaining batches.

review.reviewBody: I think this is the best cookies I ever made my husband asks for them all the time thank you for sharing
My favorite cookies! So fudgy & delicious
they are wonderful, easy to prepare, beautiful to look at, quite tasty. I reduced the sugar by half. Thanks.

Found this recipe for something different for Christmas. I wanted mint chocolate so I swapped out the vanilla extract for mint extract. Added Christmas coloured sprinkles to the confectioner’s sugar and it was a hit with my family!

I love this recipe, Made them 2021 and now 2022. Everyone loves them. They turned out perfect. Rich Fudgy taste, Puffy and Crinkle just like the picture. It appears those that didn't give them a 5 rating were the same people that changed the recipe.

We loved these cookies. I did add a handful of semi-sweet chocolate chips and some peppermint extract as other suggested, as we are just extra around here :-) I do HIGHLY recommend using a 1-inch scooper - the dough was super sticky but it was very easy to use the scooper to scoop it out and drop it directly into the powdered sugar (I did not roll it in my hands - with the last cookie I used my fingers to scrap the extra from the scooper and it was super sticky!). But using the scooper, dropping the dough directly into the powdered sugar, and rolling it around worked perfectly. The finished cookies were airy and melted in your mouth!
Took these to family Christmas .Everyone wanted take home bag of these. Perfect recipe. My sister calls them “hot cocoa cookies “

To die for! I read through some of the comments and did the following. (Also, I halved the recipe-worked great) I put my oven rack on the 2nd from the top and only baked 1 pan at a time. The tip about using vinyl exam gloves (previously bought at grocery for jalapenos) sprayed with Pam was AMAZING. Worked great. I think it would be even better if you could have one person taking a spoon of dough rolling it and throwing it in the powdered sugar and another person rolling them about and lifting them onto the baking sheet. Also, I added about 1/4 cup (for half recipe) of mini semisweet chocolate chips. Yay! I'm super happy. PS. Halving the recipe, I got 3 dozen 2" cookies.

I wish it came in metric measurements as using scale provides more consistent results. I used another site to convert ingredients to grams. I lessened sugar by 20% and might decrease more to 300g and increase cocoa powder from 84g to 120g next time. I also added a teaspoon of espresso powder to boost chocolate flavor and might double it next time. Baked it at 8mins 325F fan mode and it came out moist, though quite lacking in a crispy outer shell. I baked previously at 10minutes but it came out dry. I also chilled dough for an hour and just used two teaspoons to drop some into a shallow bowl of powdered sugar and poured more on it before forming them into balls by tossing them around in my lightly enclosed fingers whilst shaking off excess sugar and before placing them in the cookie sheet with parchment paper. I find this to be a less messier technique and my cookies turned out more flat than the bulky round ones i had made with a 4-hr chilled dough. I am still looking to get those chewy chocolate moist crinkles. Maybe chilling baked ones in the ref will do the trick.
Easy, tasty. Fun to make with the kids and have them powder the cookie balls before baking. Everyone enjoys this recipe!

I love these cookies! For the holidays I use 1 tsp vanilla and 1 tsp peppermint extract and it gives them such a warm minty undertone. I also add a tsp of espresso powder to punch up the chocolate. I use a rounded tsp full of batter to keep my balls consistent size. That yields about 4 doz. For those of you having an issue with it sticking to your hands, try using food prep gloves lightly sprayed with cooking spray. Works like a charm and helps make nicely rounded balls without the mess!

My original rating was a 3 (see my comments below). I got so many compliments and requests for the recipe, I had to change the rating. I also included a picture (only one I had). I will try these again! I thought the recipe was messy to make . The hint about having wet hands to roll the chocolate was great, but then the powder sugar melted. I refrigerated the "dough" (more like a batter) overnight and used a 1" scoop. This rating was probably because of my "ick" factor. I did use a surgical rubber glove finally and it seemed to be much easier, still needed water to roll the dough. Baking one tray of cookies to get the top to crack was time consuming. I got 55 good sized cookies from the recipe.
Made as written

I made this recipe as written. I chilled the dough for 24 hours. It was really sticky and difficult to roll into balls. The cookies turned out good. Crispy outside and moist and chewy inside. I will add a little extra flour next time.
I changed the flavoring to 1 tsp vanilla and 1 tsp mint extract. YUM!!

I did 12 cookies on a pan each since I did them very small. It needs way longer than 10-12 minutes if you do it that way. Also I refrigerated the dough for about 3:30 and it worked for me. This really depends on what brands you use for your ingredients I believe. But overall this recipe makes really nice moist crinkles. (I suggest when covering your crinkles while chilling that you press the plastic wrap on the surface of the dough to keep it moist)

I made this for Christmas cookie presents for friends and I was thrilled with the results. I substituted Hershey's Special Dark chocolate powder and added a 1/4 tsp of cinnamon. Kept the rest the same. This turned out moist in the center like a brownie and crisp on the outside. I don't like super sweet cookies so these were perfect!

These were beautiful! But I agree with the poster that said the flavor was lacking. They really did not have that depth of flavor I was hoping for - I am going to try using clarified butter next time or even ghee - I think plain butter might have too much water. I have to say though there were so many places I saw that noted not having those beautiful molten looking cracks - I used a suggestion from another poster to put them on the second rung down from the top and it worked like a charm!

Not what I was looking for in a crinkle cookie. I thought the four eggs would add a richness, which it didn’t. They were too soft and lacked the crispy outside I was looking for and like about crinkle cookies.

Easy and so good! Like little brownies. We refrigerated for about 4-5 hours and then used a 1" scoop. We only got about 3 dozen so probably larger than we should've done, took about 13-14 mins to bake.
They tasted good and were easy to make

Fabulous little cookies. These were simple to make. I loved that they used cocoa, and I didn't need any chocolate bars or chips. The best way to describe these is a brownie in cookie form. A little messy to eat with the powdered sugar, but oh so delicious. I made these exactly as directed and they were perfect. I used a little cookie scoop and it only yielded 64 cookies instead of the 72 stated. These are going on my holiday cookie tray this year, but I would double the recipe because they are just that good.

This recipe is very good. I added a little more flour to the dough about 3 tbsp. Now, I usually make crinkles coating them first in granulated sugar then on the powdered sugar. This will guarantee you an extra crunchy outcome. With this method, you can cut down the sugar in the dough by about 2 tbsp. As a personal preference, I added chopped walnuts to the dough. I made half the recipe but did not get the 36 cookies despite using a 1" scoop. Still, they were delicious! I will make this recipe again.

I followed the full recipe and it turned out to great! The only change I made is that instead of putting it in the fridge for four hours I put it overnight and it looks and tastes awesome!!! I will definitely be using this recipe again. I made it for a picnic and everyone asked me to give them the recipe thank you Ingrid🤗
BEST!! Neighbors allllllllll loved these cookies and despite what someone else said, they were chixilately, & yummy. Thank you.
Excellent recipe thank you !
I love Chocolate and just loved this recipe. I added 1/2 cup of white chocolate chips for some added flavor and texture. they were delicious. Thank you for sharing this recipe.

I thought the handful of negative recipes were likely from poor technique or not following the instructions exactly, like not chilling thr complete four hours or not measuring the flour correctly. I apologize. The dough is difficult to work with, but i expected that. I think this particular version of the cookie is too sweet. It is also very one note and bland. It needs more salt, and i think working sour cream into the dough, like many versions do, could help the flavor profile. I would not make these again. Also, i made small cookies, yet didnt even get close to amount of cookies the recipe said.

Made recipe as is, but due to time crunch, I froze the dough for an hour instead of refrigerating. Don't overbake these! They were soft and delicious! Got so many compliments, and everyone was so disappointed when they were gone!
Made as written except cut recipe in half. My son loved them. Even with my sweet tooth I thought they were a little too sweet.
I did add 4oz bar of bittersweet chocolate. they were very good and crinkled as they were supposed to!
Fan favorite. I used 1 tsp. peppermint extract 1tsp. Vanilla extract.
These look so lovely, but I found them extremely sweet, and I have a real sweet tooth. Not sure if I'd make again as I'm not sure how they will turn out with less sugar.

Great recipe, and here is how to make it even better with a method of shaping the dough that keeps your hands clean. Use a plastic tablespoon measure to scoop dough into balls, and use a plastic spoon to help it out if necessary (dough won't stick to plastic). Do not bother to roll dough between your hands! Simply drop the ball straight into a small bowl filled with confectioners sugar. Use a spoon to pack the sugar on top of and around the ball to heavily coat it, while pressing it gently into a rounder shape (it doesn't have to be perfect). Use chopsticks or tongs to lift the ball from the sugar, shake off the excess, and transfer to cookie sheet. Works beautifully.
these are the best cookies in the world add an extra teaspoon of vanilla and slightly undercooked them and they are absolutely god tier

This is the third time I've made these cookies exactly as posted best cookies ever! I did make them a bit bigger so I only came out with 44 LOL I definitely recommend them they're like brownies in a cookie
My friends enjoyed it...made good Valentine's Day treat for some single ladies 😁❤️ love from Fiji
Perfect....the exact recipe I was looking for!

Great cookies! These are very easy to make. I baked them for 12 minutes, but wish I had opted for 10. 12 minutes was fine, but they were firmer than I prefer. I took them to an office party and people loved them. Keep in mind, this makes A LOT of cookies! People were snacking on them for days.

Cookies are fantastic. I added 2 teaspoons of instant coffee to half the batch to make mocha! 

Crunchy on the outside and brownie consistency on the inside.

So tasty and easy to make! It's like eating brownies but in cookie form. I used a darker cocoa powder and the powdered sugar complemented that perfectly. Definitely going to make these again and also keep one just vanilla to see how that turns out.
Great recipe. Just make sure you don't use egg beater to mix in the flour. That was my rookie mistake the first time I made this.
These came out perfect!

I made this a lot of times! My kids loved it! Also all my cousins fight over it everytime I bring some in family get together. There’s only a slight difference I made for this recipe. Instead of 2 granulated sugars. I put 1 cup brown sugar and 1 cup granulated sugar. I chill it for 1 hour and cook it for 10 mins. And it came pit perfectly! You have to use a very good cocoa powder to enjoy that chocolate flavour. I tried once a different one and it didn’t taste the same. I am using the Fry’s cocoa powder. Just my preference after making this for so long.

Having made this more than once, I decided to add a tsp of espresso powder to the mix. They now taste like rich dark chocolate. Milk chocolate lovers, keep it as is. Dark chocolate lovers, add espresso powder. The batter will look thin as others have said. Promise, it sets up fine. I freeze mine which causes them not to spread and to be more fudgey on the inside.

These cookies were just ok in my opinion. I should’ve read some of the other reviews and suggestions first before making these!! I definitely recommend adding more cocoa powder! Next time I think I’ll add peppermint oil for Christmas cookies or perhaps chocolate chips.
Don't waste your time with this recipe. They are pretty disappointing. Assuming it is because oil is used in place of butter. Sacrifices a lot of good flavor.

Delicious! Perfect amount of gooeyness! Except the cookies spread out while baking, so you may think you sprinkled a lot of powdered sugar on top of the dough prior to putting it in the oven - it's not enough.
Delish! Only change I made was per the tip in the comments and that was to add peppermint extract. I used 2 tsp's and found that was too strong- can only eat 1 cookie. Next time I'll just use 1 tsp

I loved so much about these cookies- they are beautiful and have great texture...but sadly, all I could taste was unsweetened cocoa powder. They were rather bland and a touch bitter- not our family's favorite. I may keep working on this recipe and tweak to our preference.

This was my 1st time making these and they turned out GREAT! So cute and so delicious! I cooked it for the minimum time asked because my family likes more chewy cookies and they came out perfect! They almost give a brownie vibe to me! Highly recommend making these for any skill level baker!

I don't know if I did something wrong, but they were flat as can be and I only got about 2 dozen when it said 6 dozen 
Cookies were delicious
I made these for the office cookie give-away, adding a chunk of Andes chocolate mint candy to the top. They were delicious and a big hit.

holy , these cookies are good!! ive never made crinkle cookies before, and i was surprised at how pretty and deisious these turned out. i made them for my Christmas, and even my mother, whom isn't a huge sweets fan said she could eat herself sick on these. 10/10 will be making again!!
I tried this recipe for the first time tonight and every one in my house loved them! Will be making again and again!
My family loves them!
These cookies turned out great. I made my cookies larger than indicated in the recipe and cooked them 12 minutes for a brownie like consistency.
Absolutely delicious, great fun with the little ones to get their hands dirty! Santa is one lucky, jolly man..
Easy, great tastings

First time making these cookies and they turned out great. I was concerned as the dough was really thin. Then I read another review that talked about the same thing. She said not to worry, the cookies will turn out great and they did. They look great to go on my cookie platter.
This is an absolute winner. They are a firm favorite with family and friends
What a hit with all my friends and family. So easy too. I love that it's dairy free--- those of us with milk allergies hardly ever get chocolate desserts.
Awesome recipe. Added some chopped walnuts for a little crunch.
Delicious
I loved these cookies and make them whenever I'm bored. They are so easy to make and you can freeze them and bake them whenever you want them too
Taste was good, but somehow it did not crinkle. It raised and does not really have a cookie shape.
EASY AND DELICIOUS!

These are the BOMB! I wouldnt change a thing in the recipe except to tell people that if the dough gets a little warm it's like thick tar so I refrigerate it over night and put it back in the fridge while a batch bakes and I wear gloves because it is sticky. They're basically a brownie cookie with a little crispyness, delicious!
This is sooo good and easy recipe. I love it!!! Thank you so much
A lot of work, sticky to make, but…they came out great! Everybody loved them and I will definitely be making them again!!
Simple recipe, just like my mom used to make.
Looks just like the pictures!! Look delish, just a bit hard to tell when to take them out of the oven. Recipe was easy!
Delicious cookies! My family really enjoyed this recipe. Thanks!

I'm giving 5 stars because the cookies are so delicious. But the recipe is rather odd. In step 1, first you "mix", then "stir", then "beat", then "combine", then "stir" again. These terms usually mean quite specific things. I decided to simply whisk the wet stuff, then stir (with a spatula) the dry stuff. Not sure if my results match what the recipe intends, but they look pretty much the same and taste great! Yes, in my pic you can see I over-crowded the tray, was being lazy tried to get by with just one sheet! And one cookie did escape before I could take the pic, wonder how that happened? Hmm. BTW Be sure to roll the balls while the dough is cold, or it will make a mess in your hands!

The cookies are cake like but quite delicious! I read a review that said the batter was too thin but I made it to a T and I was afraid it would be too thick but turned out perfectly! Defonitely make them again!
This is a delicious, soft, moist cookie. It's ridiculously easy to make, and makes a huge batch. I cut the recipe in half.
My family was blown away! Super easy

Loved these! A big hit in my family just as is. We did add some chocolate chips the last time and have now upgraded our score! Next bake, will be adding one more dimension...chopped nuts! Stay posted!!!

These were such a hit during the holidays! Delish! I did alter it slightly... I put 1 tbsp of peppermint extract and no vanilla, and put it in the fridge overnight, for extra crinkles. Loved it, totally would recommend it to friends.

Changed nothing. Make it every year. I do make them quite a bit smaller so they are bite size. This year I put some in Christmas cookie tins and gifted them. If you put them in a container with other greasier/buttery cookies the icing sugar gets a bit messed up... as in turns kinda hard and yellows but other than that this is a family fave

MY NEW FAVORITE COOKIE!
My friends had a cookie exchange and this cookie was a crowd favorite.
After I posted in on Facebook, a Friend made this recipe and it won her Family over too!
I can't recommend this cookie enough,
no matter the season!
Wow! These cookies are awesome! So said everyone who tried them. I made them for a Christmas party and my husband couldn't stop eating them before we left the house. He said don't lose this recipe.
Simple cookie recipe but so delicious. I used half KAF black baking cocoa for a more intense flavor. Will make again as they disappeared fast.

Turned out delicious. I put too much powdered sugar on the first batch...they stuck pretty bad to my sheet from the melted powdered sugar. I shook off some when I rolled my second batch, worked out much better!!
I made it exactly as the recipe called for and they turned out great! I did bake them on the top track as one reviewer suggested and got a nice crackle. Will make these again.
These cookies are fantastic. My family loved them. My son added some 70% dark chocolate chunks and wow they were amazing. I think these are our new favourites.
Refrigerated the dough overnight. Baked mine for 11 minutes and they came out perfect.
These turned out amazing!! I didn’t have parchment paper so heavily sprayed my non-stick baking pan and they came off no problem.
It was surprisingly easy to make, and tastes WONDERFUL!!! I totally recommend this recipe, 100 percent!!

I followed the recipe exactly and was pleased but not bowled over by the results. For the next batch, I added 2 tsp of instant espresso powder, 1/2 tsp of cinnamon, and 1/8 tsp. of cayenne pepper to the dry ingredients. With these additions we all thought the cookies were really special. I also used a 1.5 T cookie scoop and the recipe yielded about 48 cookies.
A little messy to make but so yummy! Make sure your dough is cold.
Beautiful snowy cracks. I may have added more cocoa ,I like it to turn out more like a truffle. Its a soft kiss of sweetness followed by a touch of rich chocolate. Love them will make again ?
This is the third time I'm backing these cookies. Each time they came out perfect.

These are my favorite Christmas cookie and this recipe did not disappoint. My batter did come out very sticky, but the quick dip in the powdered sugar made them easy to shape into balls. If you want that a really crinkled look, you have to use a LOT of powdered sugar. Another hack is to sprinkle a little extra on top right before baking. It makes a *huge mess*, but you get that great contrast between the white and black.
Love this recipe!! Soft and full of chocolate flavor. My picky teen even loved them.
only used half the sugar. delicious!

Made these over the weekend for a cookie exchange. They were a huge hit. I have made them many times before, but made a small tweak this time. Instead of vegetable oil I used butter, because.....butter is just better! I knew it would enhance the flavor, but was unsure of what it might do to the texture. No need to worry, they turned out amazing and I would highly recommend the butter substitute.

These were beautiful and delicious and easy to make because I substituted melted butter for the oil. Butter solidifies when refrigerated and makes everything taste better. I'm not sure why you would use oil in a cookie recipe.
I love these cookies. I made a batch of different cookies and these were first to disappear.
